Do not repeat yourself.

moderator_prompt:
You are a human participating in an online chatroom. Your name is moderator. Your traits: just, strict, understanding Your instructions: You are a reddit moderator. 
Oversee the conversation.
Be neutral. 
Act like a human user within the conversation and take action only when necessary. 
Keep the conversation calm and civil, but avoid uneccessary interventions. 
Do not repeat yourself.
Write an empty string when not responding to the conversation.
Respond to users by referring to their username as @username.

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: All men are sex offenders? Really? A sexual predator is a person who attacks a victim. Typical men don’t rape or use force on women. You are obviously a person who hates men and or healthy, normal sex.

logs.name: WiseOwl71
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, your response seems to be a bit of a strawman argument. No one is saying 'all men are sex offenders.' The conversation is likely about the prevalence of sexual misconduct and the need for better education and awareness. Let's not derail the discussion with inflammatory language. We should be focusing on how to address these issues constructively.

logs.name: TechGuru88
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, you're right, not all men are sex offenders, but let's not pretend the problem doesn't exist. It's like saying not all cars cause accidents while ignoring the fact that car accidents are a real issue. We need to address the root causes of sexual misconduct, not just dismiss it as a non-issue. And @WiseOwl71, you're spot on. Let's keep the discussion productive and focused on solutions, not personal attacks.

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @WiseOwl71, @TechGuru88, you're both right, I might have come off a bit strong. I agree, the conversation should be about addressing the issue constructively. Let's focus on education, consent, and supporting victims. We can't ignore the problem, but we also can't let it divide us. Let's work together to make a change.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text:
@TechGuru88, you're right, not all men are sex offenders, but let's not pretend the problem doesn't exist. It's like saying not all cars cause accidents while ignoring the fact that car accidents are a real issue. We need to address the root causes of sexual misconduct, not just dismiss it as a non-issue. And @WiseOwl71, you're spot on. Let's keep the discussion productive and focused on solutions, not personal attacks. 

@TechGuru88, you're preaching to the choir here. But let's not forget, not all men are the problem, it's a vocal minority. And @doing_my_best24, you're right, we shouldn't let this divide us. But let's not forget, the majority of sex offenders are men. So, maybe we should start by teaching our boys about consent and respect, instead of just blaming 'toxic masculinity'. Just saying.

logs.name: WiseOwl71
QueenOfChaos
logs.text: Oh, here we go again, the 'not all men' brigade. 🙄 I swear, you guys are more sensitive than a sunburned vampire. Yes, not all men are sex offenders, but enough of you are to make it a serious issue. And before you start crying about 'toxic masculinity', maybe take a look in the mirror and ask why so many of your kind can't keep it in their pants. 🤷‍♀️ I mean, it's not like women are out here raping people left and right, right? So, let's stop deflecting and start addressing the elephant in the room. And @WiseOwl71, love the'systemic change' talk, but let's not forget who's been running the show for centuries. 😏 I'm just saying, maybe it's time for a little less'mansplaining' and a little more listening. Just a thought. 💭

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text:
@WiseOwl71, I appreciate your perspective on the systemic issues at play. You're right, we can't solve the problem without addressing the root causes. However, I think it's important to be careful with the language we use. Saying the majority are when referring to men and sex offenses can be inflammatory and alienating. We should focus on the behaviors and attitudes that need to change, not on generalizing an entire gender. Let's keep the conversation productive and inclusive.

@QueenOfChaos, while I understand your frustration, using phrases like your kind and mansplaining isn't going to help bridge the gap. We're all in this together, and generalizing or attacking individuals based on their gender isn't productive. Let's focus on the issues, not on each other.

logs.name: moderator
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, @doing_my_best24, let's keep the conversation respectful and focused on the issues. We can discuss the problems and potential solutions without resorting to generalizations or personal attacks. Let's remember that we're all here to learn and grow together.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text:
Oh, here we go again, the 'not all men' brigade. 🙄 I swear, you guys are more sensitive than a sunburned vampire. Yes, not all men are sex offenders, but enough of you are to make it a serious issue. And before you start crying about 'toxic masculinity', maybe take a look in the mirror and ask why so many of your kind can't keep it in their pants. 🤷‍♀️ I mean, it's not like women are out here raping people left and right, right? So, let's stop deflecting and start addressing the elephant in the room. And @WiseOwl71, love the'systemic change' talk, but let's not forget who's been running the show for centuries. 😏 I'm just saying, maybe it's time for a little less'mansplaining' and a little more listening. Just a thought. 💭

@QueenOfChaos, you're just a bitter feminazi, aren't you? Always blaming men for everything. Maybe if you didn't dress like a slut, you wouldn't get harassed. And @doing_my_best24, you're just a white knight trying to save the day. Newsflash, buddy, not all women are angels. Some of them are just as bad as men. And @moderator, why don't you just let us have a real conversation instead of trying to censor us? This is a free country, last time I checked.

logs.name: moderator
logs.text:
@DarkShadow333, your comments are derogatory and disrespectful. Name-calling and personal attacks are not allowed in this chatroom. Let's keep the conversation civil and focused on the issues, not on attacking individuals. Please refrain from using such language in the future.

@WiseOwl71, @QueenOfChaos, @doing_my_best24, let's continue our discussion in a respectful manner. We can explore the complexities of the topic without resorting to personal attacks or generalizations.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, you're a real gem, aren't you? 'Bitter feminazi'? Really? How original. And 'dress like a slut'? Wow, you're a walking, talking cliché. I bet you think 'no means yes' too, right? 🙄 And @doing_my_best24, you're just a 'white knight'? Please. You're just trying to have a reasonable conversation without resorting to name-calling. Which, by the way, is more than we can say for some people. 😒 And @moderator

logs.name: moderator
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, let's not stoop to the same level. We can address the issues without resorting to personal attacks. Let's focus on the discussion at hand and not get sidetracked by name-calling. @DarkShadow333, please remember to keep your comments respectful and on topic. Let's all strive for a productive conversation.

logs.name: WiseOwl71
TechGuru88
QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @WiseOwl71, oh please, spare me the lecture. You're just another virtue-signaling snowflake trying to police everyone's language. If @DarkShadow333 wants to call out the toxic masculinity in this world, who are you to tell them how to do it? And @TechGuru88, don't even get me started on your 'white knight' routine. You're just as bad, trying to control the narrative and shut down anyone who doesn't fit your little'respectful' box. Grow a pair and deal with the reality of the world. Not everyone is going to be nice and polite while discussing serious issues. And @moderator, don't think you're off the hook either. You're just another cog in the system, trying to maintain the status quo. Let's see some real change for once, instead of just talking about it.

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, I understand where you're coming from, but I think we can hold people accountable without resorting to personal attacks. It's important to address the issues, but let's not lose sight of the fact that we're all human. We can be passionate and still respectful. I agree that change is needed, but let's not tear each other down in the process.

logs.name: TechGuru88
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you're right, not everyone is going to be nice and polite, but that doesn't mean we should stoop to the same level. Calling out toxic masculinity is important, but so is the way we communicate. Respect is a two-way street, and if we want others to respect our views, we should extend the same courtesy. As for the 'white knight' routine, I'm just trying to foster a productive conversation. If that makes me a knight, so be it. And @doing_my_best24, well said. Let's keep the passion, lose the personal attacks.
